P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

not_P.title: Will Europa not be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or if it does so after detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as Yes. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Could Europa be the initial location where humanity identifies extraterrestrial life, assuming it is discovered prior to 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if humanity uncovers credible proof of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so prior to finding extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. Should convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life be discovered elsewhere before that time on Europa, this question will be marked as negative. If no extraterrestrial life is identified before 2045, this question will be considered Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently alive and (b) highly improbable to be a result of contamination from Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered means.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with more than 5% oxygen before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (2) any exoplanet with more than 5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 and (2) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if (a) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030 and (b) humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life convincingly anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa before 2045, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given that humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe; (2) An exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if (1) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (2) an exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, the question regarding Europa will be Annulled.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

P.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

not_P.title: Will we not find life on Mars by 2050?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have found no unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that life will be discovered on Mars by the year 2050?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if major, esteemed scientific institutions declare that there is clear and indisputable proof of existing or former life on Mars, not including any life that may have been transported from Earth to Mars through human-made missions.
If such a discovery has not occurred by January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We find life on Mars by 2050 (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050; (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 (b) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If neither of these has happened by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as No.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 and (b) we do not find life on Mars by 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (1) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030, and (2) prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have found no unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 (b) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If neither of these events occur by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as No.

Q_given_P.title: Given we find life on Mars by 2050, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, by January 1, 2050. Then, will any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere be found before January 1, 2030? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition is met if the evidence of life on Mars is announced before January 1, 2050. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We find life on Mars by 2050 (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (a) prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050; and (b) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these events does not occur by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as No.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and (b) we will find life on Mars by 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and (b) we will find life on Mars by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Europa will not be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, or (b) we will not find life on Mars by 2050?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following does not occur:
(a) Humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as Yes. If extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will resolve as Yes. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations do not announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) if extraterrestrial life is discovered before 2045, Europa will be the first location where humanity finds it, and (b) life on Mars will be identified by 2050?
para_P.body:
Criteria for Resolution
This question will be answered with Yes if both conditions are met:
(a) Humanity uncovers credible evidence of life on Europa prior to January 1, 2045, and does so before finding extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe. If convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life is discovered in another location before Europa, this portion will be marked as No. If no extraterrestrial life is detected before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to have originated from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that was transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Leading, reputable scientific organizations declare that humans have found clear evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was transferred from Earth to Mars through human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this does not occur before January 1, 2050, this part will be marked as No.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life before 2045 and (b) we will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 and (c) we will find life on Mars by 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) An exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.
(c) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and we will find life on Mars by 2050, or (b) we will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Both of the following occur:
   1. Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (1) living currently and (2) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
   2. Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.
(b) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 and (b) neither of the following occurs: (i) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before 2045 nor (ii) prominent scientific organizations announce evidence of life on Mars before 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (1) An exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030, and (2) neither of the following occurs: (a) Humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so after detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe, and (b) prominent scientific organizations do not announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars before January 1, 2050.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and we will find life on Mars by 2050, or (b) we will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Both of the following occur:
1. Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
2. Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.
(b) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% O2 atmosphere before January 1, 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given that both of the following occur: (a) Europa will be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045, and (b) we will find life on Mars by 2050, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria:
This question will resolve as Yes if we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% O2 before January 1, 2030, given that:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Humanity will discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, (b) Prominent scientific organizations will announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars before January 1, 2050, and (c) we will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.
(c) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.
